New Records: Bowden Francis held the Boston Red Sox hitless through 5 1/3 innings, extending his no-hit bid until the sixth inning.
Rich Hill became the only active player to have appeared in each of the last 20 seasons.
Key Match Events: The Toronto Blue Jays scored twice in the third and sixth innings with back-to-back doubles by Addison Barger and Ernie Clement.
Bowden Francis' no-hitter bid ended in the sixth inning when Nick Sogard blooped a soft single.
The Red Sox nearly executed a triple play in the ninth inning, a close call that could have changed the game's outcome.
Pre-Game Insights: Joe Loperfido was injured after colliding with the Green Monster, leading to cautious evaluation.
Trevor Story was set to start a rehab assignment soon, while Rafael Devers missed his third consecutive game due to shoulder soreness.
Post-Match Reflections: Blue Jays manager John Schneider praised Bowden Francis' performance, highlighting his mental and physical prowess.
The victory was seen as a pivotal moment for the Blue Jays as they approach the playoffs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Fenway Park with an attendance of 31,712.
The game was available to watch on ESPN+.
Umpires included Chris Conroy, Shane Livensparger, Brian O'Nora, and Brennan Miller.
